The patient’s infrarenal aortic aneurysm has increased in size by more than 0.5 cm in 1 year, which indicates rapid expansion and higher risk of rupture. Elective endovascular aneurysm repair is the most appropriate next step in management, as it is associated with lower morbidity and mortality rates compared to open surgical repair.

Elective endovascular aneurysm repair is recommended for patients with an abdominal aortic aneurysm greater than 5.5 cm in size or aneurysms that have rapidly expanded (>0.5 cm within six months). Adjustment of cardiovascular risk factors alone is not enough, and follow-up ultrasound in 6 or 12 months is not appropriate due to the increased risk of rupture.
